The attendees also discussed the possibility of capturing visual information, such as the position of people and the content on the board, for future analysis. They debated the practicality and ethical considerations of video recording meetings. The professor emphasized the importance of starting with a minimal preservation of information and exploring the potential usefulness of different data collection methods. The attendees agreed to consider note-taking and oral summaries as potential approaches for generating meeting summaries. Overall, the meeting focused on finding effective ways to collect and store data for future analysis and user-interface design.
